DOC.brief_summary: The target rapamycin complex 2 ( TORC2 ) evolutionarily conserve serine/threonine protein kinase control growth metabolism . In mammal ( include human ) , mammalian TOR complex 2 ( mTORC2 ) contain mammalian TOR ( mTOR ) , RICTOR , mSIN1 protein , mLST8 gene . In animal model , adipose-specific rictor knockout ( AdRiKO ) mouse , systemic insulin resistance , hepatic steatosis , cardiovascular dysfunction develop upon high fat diet ( HFD ) -induced obesity age . To find molecular link adipose mTORC2 systemic insulin resistance , investigator already perform transcriptomics proteomics analysis visceral white adipose tissue mouse model . The aim study confirm molecular link adipose mTORC2 systemic insulin resistance human .
DOC.criteria: Obese volunteer ( BMI > 35kg/m2 ) age 18 maximum 60 year , male female ; insulinresistant , schedule elective bariatric surgery . Normal weight patient ( BMI < 27kg/m2 ) age 18 max . 60 year , male female ; insulinsensitive , schedule elective surgery . Known diabetes mellitus Chronic inflammatory disease ( inflammatory bowel disease , rheumatoid disease , cancer ) Acute inflammatory disease Known renal disease : kidney failure Pregnancy : history gastrointestinal surgery major change gastrointestinal tract ( removal stomach , GIbypass ) Substance abuse , alcohol abuse Inability follow procedure due psychological disorder , dementia insufficient knowledge project language ( German )
